head.title: Soaring Prices of Oil Roil U.S. and Europe

hedline.hl1: Soaring Prices of Oil Roil U.S. and Europe

block.p: Despite the decision over the weekend by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to increase crude oil production, the price of home heating oil in the United States surged to a 10-year high, and alarm over gasoline costs erupted in panic buying and demonstrations across Western Europe.

Despite the decision over the weekend by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to increase crude oil production, the price of home heating oil in the United States surged to a 10-year high, and alarm over gasoline costs erupted in panic buying and demonstrations across Western Europe.

Emboldened by the success of French protests last week -- which resulted in the government's decision to lower fuel taxes by 15 percent -- groups in Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands and Germany mounted or prepared to mount their own actions. But Prime Minister Tony Blair of Britain said his government would not lower gasoline taxes. Articles, Pages A3 and C1.
